page.title: 08THE RAILWAY NEAR HOBY - 2
page.content:
Hoby did not have a railway station just a railway line.
The line from Leicester to London might be electrified & hopefully the A.P.T.running from Leicester. That is what the British Rail area manager for Leicestershire has got in mind for the late 1990,s.But neither Hoby nor Melton Mowbray will be electrified.British Rail are using the Leicester to Peterborough line for tests on Sundays. Some of them come from the Old Dalby Test track which tests theories of British Rails Technical Designers like for instance for GEC who crashed Locomotive No.46009 into a nuclear flask at 100mph.
On any train that passes Hoby you can see all of the village.
